instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, liquid damaged FRU, <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> / <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR>, Spins up, no boot
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> supposedly replaced with a new board a couple of weeks ago. Clear signs board has seen liquid damage and was ultrasonic'd and put back in to service as it probably booted "then".

Now the unit will only green/orange light & fan spin. The fan spin runs for about 10 seconds, then stops, then starts again, and about 7~8 minutes later stops completely. LED on USB will flash once on initial power, and then when the fan spins up again after the 10 second lull point but never again.

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 8.6V, 3V42 present too. All other rails present that I've bee able to test, including CPU at 1.8V

Bubbling corrosion on the tracks for <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> / <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR>, as well as corrosion under <RESISTOR>R8152</RESISTOR>.

Problem might be that <SIGNAL>CPU_VCCST_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is being pulled down slightly to 0.98V from 1.05V, I've removed <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R1800</RESISTOR> and the slight pull down still occurs, leaving either the PCB or the CPU causing the slight pull down.

BIOS, SMC, RTC Gen, PCH HSIO Switch ( <CHIP>U8005</CHIP> ) all checked/replaced and appear to be okay.

Feel like I'm missing something blatently obvious.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, liquid damaged FRU, <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> / <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR>, Spins up, no boot
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is also present (3V3), starting to run out of ideas on this one.  Might have to put it aside for another day  ( tested the chassis with another board, all okay ).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>, liquid damaged FRU, <CHIP>U1930</CHIP> / <RESISTOR>R1931</RESISTOR>, Spins up, no boot
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU_PH1</SIGNAL> is 12.6R  - so it's possibly marginal, but overall I think it's time to just let this one drift away.  Hard letting go.
